figure.note: Pen and ink drawing: arch bridge

div.ab: Quit PUENTE DE ORBIGO i.e. a bridge over the Órbigo [not the modern Puente de Órbigo, which is off WG's route] at 5m to 7 Octob 4 Fine hot day Xcross the bridge. Ilex common. 2 p 7 7.02 the wood Rright where the Spanish army halted previous to the affair of Rio Seco Battle of Medina de Rioseco, 14 July 1808 ends. A house beyond it. 3 Villages at foot of hills R. 25 p 7 VillVillage. 37 p 8 large convent & trees Lleft. 10 p 9 Vill R. across the great River Orvigo Órbigo. A woody country R of that. Road in forest of Ilex. 10 p 10 the town of Benevente Benavente surrounded by a mud wall. On Eeast side mud stones. a College & some convents. The streets very wretched the Posada Inn tolerable. The French staid 15 hours in the town & got some money from the College. Quit Benevente at 15m to 1h poor place. 25 p 1 long & dangerous [drawing: arch bridge] because ruined. Large river under it flows to R & joins the Orbigo & Douro &c &c Enter Sandy country, no stones. Toll gate. 5 to 3 Vill L. 25 p 3 distt Vill L. 10 p 4 2 Vills Serazino de los Varios & next Serazin de la Ordin Cerecinos de los Barrios and Cerecinos de la Orden (now jointly Cerecinos de Campos). Cellars cut out of the bank in sand here.
div.note: Benavente of the Duchess of Ossuna Osuna – Her Son Prince of Anglona in Naples. Their Castle very curious & old. The French spoiled it. Armour in the hall old & said to be fine –
Believe the river is the Esla –
